paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper investigated the prevalence of TTR-FAP in a North American population with idiopathic neuropathy. No TTR variants were found in the study cohort, but individual cases with known TTR mutations were discussed.

patients.phenotype: very slowly progressive purely sensory symptoms affecting feet, moderate axonal sensorimotor polyneuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: very slowly progressive purely sensory symptoms affecting feet, moderate axonal sensorimotor polyneuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 70-year-old man of Italian origin, known for coronary artery disease and obstructive sleep apnea, presented with a 30-year history of very slowly progressive purely sensory symptoms affecting his feet and more recently ascending to the knees.

functional_data.summary: The patient was started on diflunisal and had some improvement in sensory symptoms and neuropathic pain.

variants.segregation_data: Family history significant for mother with neuropathy symptoms at age 80.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a family history of neuropathy and was initially misdiagnosed with HSAN type I.
key_quotes: He consulted in another institution and was found to have a Val30met mutation in the TTR gene.

patients.phenotype: cardiomyopathy without polyneuropathy, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome

functional_data.summary: Patient presented with cardiomyopathy and bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome.

variants.additional_notes: Patient presented with cardiomyopathy without polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: Patient #1, Val122Ile mutation; presented with a cardiomyopathy without polyneuropathy and was found to have bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome.

patients.phenotype: cardiomyopathy without polyneuropathy, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome

functional_data.summary: Patient presented with cardiomyopathy and bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome.

variants.additional_notes: Patient presented with cardiomyopathy without polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: Patient #2, Asp38Ala mutation; presented with a cardiomyopathy without polyneuropathy and was found to have bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome.

patients.phenotype: upper extremity predominant neuropathy, bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome

functional_data.summary: Patient presented with upper extremity predominant neuropathy and bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome.

variants.additional_notes: Common presentation of TTR-FAP in non-endemic areas.
key_quotes: Patient #3, Val50Met mutation; presented with an upper extremity predominant neuropathy, which appears to be a common presentation of TTR-FAP in non-endemic areas.

challenges: No variants were found in the study cohort, but individual cases with known TTR mutations were discussed.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper did not report any new variants in the study cohort, but discussed known variants in individual cases.
